OpenVDB Points

0.1.0

The OpenVDB Points library extends Dreamworks' OpenVDB library to provide the ability to efficiently represent point and attribute data in VDB Grids. Points are spatially-organised into VDB voxels to provide faster access and a greater opportunity for data compression compared with linear point arrays. By building on top of OpenVDB, this library can re-use a lot of the work already in place for the large, open-source OpenVDB toolset and active community of users.

See the OpenVDB Points GitHub page for a summary of what's included in the library and how to compile.

See the Overview for an introduction to the library.

See the FAQ for frequently asked questions about OpenVDB Points.

See the Cookbook to get started using OpenVDB Points.

See the Release Notes for what's new in this version of OpenVDB Points.

See the Road Map for an idea as to the future direction of OpenVDB Points.

Contributors, please familiarize yourselves with OpenVDB's Coding Standards.
